text: whoo these smell good one and a half
cups of toasted almonds I have my oven
at 350 to make an amazing sweet salty
toffee chocolate almond cookies barely
any baking involved you are not going to
believe it so you start out by lining
your tray a baking sheet with aluminum
foil and then just line up 14 graham
crackers just the regular kind covering
the bottom of your lined tray then you
just pour a bag of chopped up coffee
bits all over the top put that aside for
a sec now that your almonds have cooled
off a little bit you can chop them up
how do you know when your nuts are
toasted well you could use a timer which
I highly recommend the other way to tell
is by the smell they should have a more
intense nutty smell and then you know
they're done sometimes if you're not
using a timer you don't smell them until
it's too late and then all of a sudden
they're burnt so at 350 degrees I would
start checking after about 10 minutes so
these can go right on top of those
toffee chips now I'm going to make a
little bit of a butter sauce to go on
top come with me to the stove take your
two sticks of butter and put them into
your pot with your 1/2 cup of sugar all
you need to do is cook it until it's
foamy and a little bit syrupy that'll
take a couple minutes turn it off and
then pour it all over this situation
this buttery sugary mixture is going to
seep in and make everything stick
together and be absolutely fantastically
delicious 350 degrees for about 12
minutes and now I'm just going to chop
up the chocolate to put on the top of
the end it Walla 4 ounces of semi-sweet
chocolate and then you chop this up and
you're going to pour this over the top
so see the serrated edge it's perfect
for cutting up chocolate because the
little serrated misses make it so that
the chocolate doesn't slip and they go
right through the chocolate and the nuts
we are about ready this chocolate looks
fine enough to melt evenly oh my gosh
look at how hot and bubbling that is you
just want to put it on a cooling rack
because it's SuperDuper hot then
sprinkle the chocolate all over the top
you want to make sure you do it when
it's still SuperDuper hot because then
the chocolate melts don't worry about it
cooling off too quickly because there's
nothing hotter in the world maybe
besides lava then hot sugar one more
thing 3/4 of a teaspoon of coarse salt
make sure you cut the mother warm while
they're still kind of soft otherwise
they'll break into pieces use a pastry
wheel or a knife whatever you have but I
think we say two inch squares but really
any size you want so I've been standing
here for an hour waiting for this just
to cool so that I can taste one and
there's still not cool but one tiny
little edge is cool so I can taste this
which is all the delicious goodness on
it seven ingredients barely any cooking
one of the most delicious things you'll
ever taste salted toffee nut chocolate
cookie
